derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English styntan 'make blunt', of Germanic origin; related to stunt

entry.tran: (在某地的)工作时间，活动时间
entry.def: A stint is a period of time which you spend doing a particular job or activity or working in a particular place.

example.ex: He is returning to this country after a five-year stint in Hong Kong.
example.tran: 他在香港工作了5 年后即将回国。

means.word_mean: 1. an unbroken period of time during which you do something;

sentences.sentence: "he did a stretch in the federal penitentiary"

means.word_mean: 3. an individuals prescribed share of work;

sentences.sentence: "her stint as a lifeguard exhausted her"

means.word_mean: 2. supply sparingly and with restricted quantities;

means.word_mean: 慷慨地做某事；不遗余力地做某事

sentences.en: She praises her pupils without stint.
sentences.cn: 她极力夸奖自己的学生。

sentences.en: Don’t stint yourself;take all you want.
sentences.cn: 不要限制自己, 想要多少拿多少。
